clinical_study.brief_title: Electronic Warning System for Atrial Fibrillation
clinical_study.official_title: Electronic Warning System to Improve Stroke Prevention in Atrial Fibrillation - A Quality Improvement Initiative at the University Hospital Bern

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this randomized controlled study is to evaluate whether a newly designed electronic warning system will increase the initiation rate of adequate stroke preventive measures in patients with atrial fibrillation.

detailed_description.textblock: A large proportion of patients with atrial fibrillation do not receive stroke prevention therapy in line with the guidelines, in spite of the presence of an increased risk of stroke. It will be investigated whether an electronic alert to physicians, whose patients with atrial fibrillation do not receive stroke preventive measures, will increase the rate of adequate stroke preventive measures as compared to a control group of patients without an electronic alert. The electronic alerts will be sent if patients with atrial fibrillation but without adequate stroke preventive measures receive in-patient treatment at the University Hospital Bern. The electronic alert system includes a feature that helps the physicians in charge to evaluate the CHA2DS2VASC Score. At the end of the hospital stay medical discharge letters will be reviewed for initiation of adequate stroke preventive measures.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of initiation of adequate measures to prevent stroke (oral anticoagulant prescription) by physician in charge
primary_outcome.time_frame: End of hospital stay (expected average duration of 1 week)

secondary_outcome.measure: Use of the CHA2DS2VASc score calculation tool by the physician in charge
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During hospital stay (expected average duration of 1 week)

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of correct evaluation of the CHA2DS2VASC Score through the calculation tool by physician in charge
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of hospital stay (expected average duration of 1 week)

arm_group.description: Physicians, whose patients with atrial fibrillation do not receive stroke preventive measures, will receive an electronic warning alert.
Physicians, whose patients with atrial fibrillation do not receive stroke preventive measures, will receive no electronic warning alert.

intervention.description: A newly-installed warning system for stroke prevention in atrial fibrillation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All in-patients with atrial fibrillation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Ongoing anticoagulant therapy
